reviews.text: Its a great please to visit specially with your kids. And suggestion is to go as early as possible so that you have the exact time to explore everything. Specially kids love and can have practical experience with the sceintific stuff this place have. Space, Robotics, Dynamics, Gravity etc etc... you will not regret...

Seemed like a lot of other people had complaints about this museum, but I spent a half a day here and it was free as a foreigner. I really enjoyed the museum as it had tons of interactive parts. Great for children and anyone interested in having fun and learning about science.

Convenient location,  easy to get to and a nice place to visit for tourists.   Interesting to see some similarities and differences in how things are presented.  

Entrance to the museum is free.   Foreigners have to bring a passport so be sure to have it.   Fun place to visit for anyone that likes science.   For those in science and technology related (STEM)  line of work, come with a open mind and you'll like this place.  You can quickly walk thru this.  Kids who like STEM field may like to spend all day here.

Very nice science museum, exhibits are very well placed and organized. Especially the magnetic fluid on 2nd flour it's very interesting.
Though every exhibit has English subtitles, still I feel more explanations in English are needed.
There is no ticket, however you need to have your passport.
This museum is all about the history of China. The museum is bug and modern. I recommend it

If you are looking for somewhere inexpensive to have some lunch then come here as you have plenty to choose from. At this centre you cam buy almost anything from pork to chicken and everything in between and it will just cost under S$10 For a nice meal.
We have pork and duck meat with a pork soup and it was delicious. If you want to try something different then go for the black skin chicken. For drinks you can get anything from water to tea or coffee.
I had so much fun that hippies are so cool I smoke some of the best weed for the best price

A great space and part of Berkeley's story, student accommodation not sure? A refuge and a place of reflection for Berkeley siders, keep People's Park as it is, a moving story and inportant history that should be preserved and improved.

Peoples Park is a precious green space. I play live acoustic music at Peoples Park whenever I get a chance, guitar songs, jazz, funk, folk, rock, samba, bossa nova, percussion... I have old friends there and did community gardening there for five years, growing 13 foot tall corn and green beans, and all kinds of stuff. The trees and plants there are good old friends too. I've heard lots of great bands on the Free Speech Stage, summer concerts, the Berkeley World Music series, drum jams, dancing. Its very interesting, I've learned a lot there, talking to people, about history, people, culture, plants, gardening.

I have always loved this old park.
Sad it is always under attack and it is purposely kept decrepit by the University to justify building on it.
Guess everyone will use Williard Park should the unelected have their way.
The Ancient Street Pedestrian Enjoyable Shops And Buildings Of Chinese Architecture There Are Many Interesting Items We ‘d Learn How’ s Good living Here
Hmm nice park to relax away from the hot sun, but no escape from the crowds. Not much to see by nature of being a burial site, but is full of informative signs and tidbits from history.

Dedicated to Liu Bei and his allies. Includes the tomb of Liu Bei. Huge place worth a visit. Next to it is an old shopping street that feels more authentic than the overly commercialized Kuanzhai Alley.
Worth to visit. The entrance fee is 25 y

Temple for three kings of Three Kingdoms era. It has historical memories of three regimes during the Three Kingdoms Period, Wei, Shu and Wu, originated in 220 AD when Wei replaced the Eastern Han Dynasty (25 AD-220 AD) and ended in 280 AD when the Wu was defeated by the Court of Jin.

This is a fantastic museum and well worth a visit. It includes both the archeological site where the excavations took place which is well explained and the main museum which included the artefacts which they found. The museum is very good even for English speakers as everything is available in English. It is worth noting that there is a really good audio guide available in both Chinese and English. Simply scan the we chat code as you walk into the excavation site accept the friend, click on them and then click on the first button with Chinese on the bottom left of the screen and choose audio guide.

Interesting place with a lot of interesting history behind it however if you can’t read or understand spoken Chinese you will not get very much out of it. Even the apps available offer little information about the relics in English. I suggest if you do want to go, take a guide or tour if you can only speak English.

The dig site itself is quite bland and very very hot, the rest of the museum and gardens are quite comfortable and interesting. Price is reasonable and worth the visit, but don’t expect to get a whole lot out of it if you can’t read/understand chinese.

Jinsha site was accidentally discovered in February 2001 during a real estate construction. The site flourished around 1000 BC. Ivory, jade artifacts, bronze objects, gold objects and carved stone objects were found at the site. The city was build on the banks of Modi river.
The Golden Sun Bird excavated from Jinsha site is now the official emblem/logo of Chengdu.
This place is good
nice place with some historical story

Good to visit. It is known as  Quingyang Temple or Quingyang Palace. Located on the southwestern side of Changdu City. Nice to watch temple gate guarded by two lion stone statues. There is a series of sculptures inside. Fee was 10 CNY.
The place here is Just okay

Beats Hong Kong Disney land any day many rides fun for the whole family

Bonito y tranquilo, el clima super agradable

I love this ancient town （街子古镇）. Beautiful clean town next to the river. People lived in this town back in time must be very wealthy. Even the town was small, It has a collection of culture, traditions, business and architectures. I saw kids playing on the old stone street peacefully and happily. There were Lots of street food to choose from. Try 浆心豆腐脑near the Four Ginkgo Tree square. It was delicious!
Beautiful Ancient City, lot's to see and do, a small taste of old Chinese tradition & culture.
Great area to walk around. Traditional vendors in ancient buildings

It's an ancient style town. Leave your stomach empty when you go visit. There are various local snacks to fill you up. Some tea houses are located on the river and near the bridge. The antique store near the bridge has some very cool pieces. The town is crowded over the weekend.
Very cosy with an authentic feel,  beautiful streets and many shops. Worth a visit!

One of the best authentic Sichuan spicy hotpot restaurants.  Chain restaurant, but excellent service, food quality and environment.

The sitting/waiting/tea area on the second floor is surrounded by historical photos of old Sichuan.  Truly a preservation of local culture.
Nice food and service.
It's very cheap and tasty good.

Ate a breakfast omelette there. It was okay. Service was slow considering we were the only ones there. I hear lunch is better so I'll try it again.
Livers and onions they have lots of other good food not bad for big lake
Got the buffet. Chicken fried steak w/cream gravy and all kinds of delicious sides. Wonderful meal for the price.
Awesome burgers. They truly are the best in town
Good Cinco nachos, good service

It’s a warm & cozy place. Good to come to making a new friends. If you’re alone this place is your choice! Food so tasty ,Homemade Pizza and Buffalo chicken wings!!! And people so friendly.  👍🏾 The latest one they’s have a cute dog name Lacy you can come and play with her🐶

Friends, food, and drinks. What more can you ask for. A dive bar that's not your average dive bar. Order the double double for a party, or get a beer and have conversation. This place has charm, versatility, and resilience. Definitely worth a check.
Great food, cheap drinks, awesome music (plus play your own!), good vibes. Best dive bar in Chengdu!
